definition: to whet the appetite/appetizing/to amuse oneself at sb's expense/to tease

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: And make the duck breast not too oily.
sentences.chinese: 話梅酸酸好開胃，仲令鴨胸無咁膩。

sentences.english: The guests were all in the dining room now, sitting down to their excess of appetizers.
sentences.chinese: 客人們現在都坐在餐廳裏，喫開了他們奢華的開胃菜。

sentences.english: I can still taste the pickled chicken feet and mushroom appetizers.
sentences.chinese: 我還嘗過醃過的雞爪和蘑菇開胃菜。

sentences.english: Serving multiple appetizers and finger foods cuts down on your work.
sentences.chinese: 提供多種開胃菜和能減少你工作量的手抓食物。

sentences.english: For appetizer my wife will have smoked salmon, but I preferashrimp cocktail.
sentences.chinese: 我太太要薰鮭魚作開胃菜，但是我想要蝦子。

sentences.english: The tradition of serving starters or hors d'oeuvres is said to have arisen in Russia.
sentences.chinese: 上開胃菜或餐前小點心的傳統據說起源於俄羅斯。

sentences.english: Share an appetizer or a dessert with a friend.
sentences.chinese: 同朋友一起分享開胃品或甜點。

sentences.english: Serve jello as cold dishes or ordinary appetizers would fit perfectly.
sentences.chinese: 無論是夏日消暑小品或平日的開胃小點均適宜。

sentences.english: Bring your own healthy entrée or appetizer to the party.
sentences.chinese: 自帶你的健康主食或者開胃菜去聚會。

sentences.english: Soup can serve as a great appetizer to a meal, or as an  entree.
Next time when you have dinner in an Italian restaurant, order yourself prosciutto with cantaloupe to start the meal.
sentences.chinese: 下次去意大利餐廳時，點一份火腿哈密瓜開胃菜。

sentences.english: I think a bottle of champagne would be a good idea. It's appetizing and tasty.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得來瓶香檳也會是不錯的主意，又開胃又可口。

sentences.english: It is thus possible that aperitifs may have sometimes preceded the first course in England.
sentences.chinese: 因此，在英國開胃酒可能在第一道菜之前上桌。

sentences.english: Later, when he was recovering, she made him appetising cups of beef-tea or gruel.
sentences.chinese: 後來他病好，又拿牛肉茶或是燕麥粥給他開胃。

sentences.english: Server pick up the small samples(amuse bouche) from the kitchen and bring to the customers.
sentences.chinese: 服務員到廚房給客人拿餐前開胃小喫。

definition: lit. just the right flavor/just right/just the thing/excellent
grease/greasy food/oily/rich (of food)/fatty/greasy and dirty/a slippery character
to read smoothly (of text)/to blurt out (without thinking)/to suit one's taste (of food)
umami, one of the five basic tastes (cookery)
